name: NPR
text:
Florida has issued a directive requiring all school districts to offer in-person instruction. 

But as COVID-19 cases surge in the state, many educators are questioning the push to reopen schools next month. https://t.co/1lXXu4QFOA

name: NPR
text:
Indonesia now has more than 80,000 confirmed coronavirus cases, with more than 3,200 dead. Epidemiologists say it's due to government failures, including misinformation.

"I don't think Indonesia has the means to stop the disease now," one scientist says.
https://t.co/ZPAED77O95

name: NPR
text:
The NSA says Russian hackers are attempting to break into organizations working on a potential coronavirus vaccine. The agency believes they're part of the group blamed for hacking Democratic Party emails in 2016.
 https://t.co/ifUFQHMxgJ

name: NPR
text:
The Republican party has announced it will scale back its August convention in Florida.

Attendance for the first few days will be limited to RNC delegates, which is a little more than 2,500 people. The final day is expected to total about 7,000. https://t.co/9XPvSwlwii

name: NPR
text:
The Asheville City Council has approved a reparations resolution for Black residents and formally apologized for the local government's historic role in slavery and racist and discriminatory policies.
https://t.co/C2hFNAycTe

name: NPR
text:
In 2013, the GOP produced a report laying out how the party should move forward ‚Äî including expanding outreach to people of color, women and young voters.

Today, it's a window into the pressures that some fear will hurt the party for generations to come.
https://t.co/jRvwI6HecK

name: NPR
text:
Capt. Tom Moore will soon become Capt. Sir Tom Moore.

The 100-year-old WWII veteran will be knighted by Queen Elizabeth II on Friday after he raised more than $40 million for health care workers by walking laps in his garden.
https://t.co/rWN0JAq1aH

name: NPR
text:
The mayor of New Bedford, Mass., issued emergency orders with a set of enforceable guidelines to protect essential workers during the pandemic. Safety experts say it could be a model for cities across the country.
https://t.co/hIIA9QTlVH

name: NPR
text:
India has set a new record for its daily coronavirus cases, reporting 32,695 new infections on Thursday. The country's numbers continue to soar ‚Äî exceeded only by the United States and Brazil.
https://t.co/tOMHip0Md9

name: NPR
text:
In May, President Trump vetoed a bipartisan bill promoting debt forgiveness for veterans who were defrauded by for-profit schools.

Now, the Department of Veterans Affairs is allowing several repeat-offending schools access to GI Bill money.
 https://t.co/tJqz1nv9oa

name: NPR
text:
Supermarkets and gas stations across the U.S. are grappling with the pandemic-induced coin shortage.

To combat the low supply, some are loading change onto loyalty cards ‚Äî while others are rounding up amounts to donate to charity.
https://t.co/rxZCYXBTbZ

name: NPR
text: RT @m_scribe: Rwandans know what it is like to lose hundreds of thousands of relatives and friends in just a few months. Here's how they are recovering: by remembering the dead and vowing "never again." My latest for @nprworld   https://t.co/kMxUTLgmr2

name: NPR
text:
The Met will reopen to the public in late August. Officials said "comprehensive" new health and safety procedures will be put in place ‚Äî including requiring masks and limiting the number of visitors.
https://t.co/BMjYWCJ6u0

name: NPR
text:
Author Joanna Cole, whose Magic School Bus series made science both dazzling and fun for generations of children, died over the weekend at age 75. The beloved TV show aired for 18 years.
https://t.co/YKmQzYuQnw

name: NPR
text:
Electronic musicians from Mexico, Central America and the Caribbean sampled the sounds of endangered birds from their countries for a new album ‚Äî and its proceeds go directly toward efforts to save them.
https://t.co/HaHDFJxM5v

name: NPR
text:
A new step-by-step manual from the Vatican that details how to investigate and report sexual abuse cases involving clergy calls on church authorities to alert civil officials even if not required to do so by law.
https://t.co/qaWe1QKbkq

name: NPR
text:
Americans are on pace to buy more guns than ever amid the pandemic. And nearly half of all the sales appear to be to first-time gun owners.

One economist's analysis says racial tensions are driving at least some of the surge in sales.
https://t.co/wsZfdSpRDS

name: NPR
text:
Stephen Graham Jones's new novel follows the aftermath of an elk hunt gone wrong and one man who's haunted by it. 

It's a story of revenge and sorrow, but also tradition and identity ‚Äî and that identity, Native American, isn't monolithic here. 
https://t.co/Jkw17HeMiG

name: NPR
text:
‚ùì Is it safe to visit grandparents? 
üöó Drive or fly? 
üè® Stay with them, or get a hotel? 
ü•ò Eat out, or stay in? 

We know you‚Äôve got questions. Epidemiologist and infectious disease specialist Dr. Ravina Kullar has some answers.
https://t.co/clbpMNKzNz

name: NPR
text: A collaborative mission between NASA and the European Space Agency has captured the closest photos ever taken of the sun ‚Äî revealing mini solar flares that scientists are calling "campfires." https://t.co/Gdd8VVZ7jS

name: NPR
text:
NPR correspondent @pamelafessler, author of "Carville's Cure: Leprosy, Stigma, and the Fight for Justice," talks about her research into this once feared disease ‚Äî and its connection to COVID-19.
https://t.co/PodRzYxwCC

name: NPR
text:
MIS-C apparently responds well to treatment, but it's new enough ‚Äî and mysterious enough ‚Äî that doctors want to make sure the children who recover don't experience any related health complications in the future.
https://t.co/kS4kPxFewj

name: NPR
text:
Long known as firebrands ready to take on abusers, country music and the president, the trio now known as @TheChicks is finding ‚Äî on its first album in 14 years ‚Äî beauty in loss and lonesomeness.
https://t.co/vBLR1HjklA

name: NPR
text:
High-schooler Emelia gets the chance to go back and change one decision in her past ‚Äî but then she has to live with the changes.

It‚Äôs ‚ÄúPretty in Pink‚Äù meets ‚ÄúSliding Doors‚Äù in this what-if story. üëá
https://t.co/E5tEb6HjgL

name: NPR
text:
Los Angeles rolled out a new city program that will provide assistance to renters in the form of subsidies up to $2,000 per household.

More than 100,000 people applied the first day, but only 50,000 families will be selected. https://t.co/6MFgZ7QRsP

name: NPR
text:
Twenty-seven sites and organizations have been given a total of $1.6 million in grants to help preserve spaces that tell often-overlooked parts of American history, "through the lens of Black humanity and identity."
https://t.co/6wzd1J28De

name: NPR
text:
Hewan Alemayehu is a nurse anesthetist at two hospitals in Virginia.

In early April, she made the toughest decision of her life: In order to protect her family from COVID-19, she would leave them. (@wamu885) https://t.co/QvpZWoYA8Q

name: NPR
text:
Racism is a danger to the economy, says the president of the Atlanta Federal Reserve Bank.

"By limiting economic and educational opportunities for a large number of Americans, institutionalized racism constrains this country's economic potential." https://t.co/kFdiHBHKbu

name: NPR
text:
Opinion:  ‚ÄúKaren has become cultural shorthand for a white woman who wields her race as a cudgel,‚Äù writes @karenbates. ‚ÄúBut where did this archetype come from?‚Äù

Before ‚ÄúKaren,‚Äù there was a ‚ÄúBecky‚Äù and a ‚ÄúMiss Ann.‚Äù 
https://t.co/xjies9Ft1x

name: NPR
text:
In India, TikTok has given birth to new social media celebrities, and many of them have used the app to find a path out of poverty.

But now, those stars have become collateral damage in a geopolitical flare-up between India and China. 
https://t.co/Sw9IfzKbxx

name: NPR
text: Police bodycam video of George Floyd's final minutes of life shows him telling officers he's claustrophobic and has anxiety. He begs them not to put him in the back of a squad car, offering to lie on the ground instead. https://t.co/8oMbOFbcAH

name: NPR
text:
With Minor League Baseball canceled, fans cheered on an amateur league for men age 35 and over.

"I've been playing for years," says 73-year-old Gary Broach, the oldest player in the league. "I've enjoyed it and will enjoy it till the day I die."
https://t.co/qbkeArh5Ck

name: NPR
text:
NASA is sending a six-wheeled rover called Perseverance to Mars to look for signs of microbial life stored in the rocks at Jezero crater, which scientists think was once a lake.
https://t.co/wpbztaELvA

name: NPR
text:
With around 4 out of 10 homes nationwide left uncounted, Census Bureau workers are set to start in-person visits on July 30 to unresponsive households in Hawaii, North Dakota, Puerto Rico and other areas.
https://t.co/hrOo4qmoXa

name: NPR
text:
Cardboard beds for overcrowded ICUs. 

An urban farm with free vegetables for families in need. 

An app that provides easy access to virtual worshipping options. 

Here are some of the ways regular folks are solving problems during the pandemic: https://t.co/2VYraxjJ6E

name: NPR
text:
European Union leaders were going into their first face-to-face meeting in months on Friday ‚Äî hoping to hammer out details of a 1.85 trillion euro ($2.1 trillion) EU budget and COVID-19 recovery plan.
https://t.co/0B5ZjEnjvt

name: NPR
text:
Federal law enforcement have been using unmarked vehicles to drive around downtown Portland and detain protesters since at least July 14.

Personal accounts and multiple videos show officers detaining people with no explanation and driving off. (@OPB)
https://t.co/SIbYgjjnQN

name: NPR
text:
President Trump gave a new foreign aid agency an unusual task: Give loans to domestic companies to help refill the depleted U.S. medical stockpile. 

Now, House appropriators are calling for an independent review.
https://t.co/CFWL5ffRkR

name: NPR
text:
JUST IN: The men charged with the murder of Ahmaud Arbery have pleaded not guilty. Arbery was shot in February while jogging in Glynn County, Georgia.
https://t.co/U7UtEW9QhR

name: NPR
text: Join Guy Raz for a LIVE interview with Songe LaRon, the co-founder of Squire as they discuss building a company around problems in your everyday life, and how Covid-19 has impacted them and their customers. https://t.co/XCzC21AOO8

name: NPR
text: BREAKING: Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg says her cancer has returned and that chemotherapy is yielding‚Ä¶ https://t.co/LTAjLQGHse

name: NPR
text:
While in quarantine, Kenneth decided to come out to his daughter at the age of 90.

He opened up to her about Phillip, a man he met in the '50s who became the love of his life ‚Äî and whom he never stopped thinking about.

"To me, he was the perfect person."
https://t.co/49FvIJjL8U

name: NPR
text:
Jamaal Bowman, an education advocate and former middle school principal, has defeated longtime Rep. Eliot Engel in the Democratic primary for New York's 16th Congressional District, The AP projects.
https://t.co/lLdj3BGDUS
